intro: Cadetia umbellata, commonly known as the umbellate bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Boraginaceae family. It is characterized by its clustered, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is native to regions in Europe and parts of Asia. It has hairy stems and leaves that are often lance-shaped. Cadetia umbellata is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges.
